ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: morning pages and consistent writing, solo performance, composing and performing the one person play, audience engagement

I learned helpful acting tactics and what connects a performer to an audience. The in-class exercises give students the valuable experience of performing in front of an audience every week in a nonjudgemental space.; students also learn a lot from watching their peers perform. It's insightful to hear the feedback given to other students.
How to compose and perform the one person play. How to be creative.

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments: Strengths: collaborative feel, good class community, fun discussions, professor is open to differing POVs, unique and interesting premise

I think the length of this class (2 hr seminar) allows everyone to really deep dive into the material. I feel like we go really in depth to readings and performance exercises every class. We do often have a good amount of homework weekly since the class only meets once a week.

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: Yes! Super interesting course even for students with no theater experience! A very unique experience, and a great intro to the diverse range of one person plays.

I would definitely recommend this course! It's super rewarding and really gets you out of your comfort zone. The community of the class is also amazing since it's a pretty small group. It feels very inspiring to create and share art with other people who are just as excited about it. Everyone is supportive and nonjudgemental toward creative risks.
